website_summaries.verdict: Though it may occasionally report inaccurate readings, it's reliable for the most part, fast, and has practical features – all for a mid-range price.
pros: An attractive model with a vivid backlit screen that can be easily seen from a distance
cons: Discrepancies about its accuracy – some owners rave about it while others find it can be unreliable
Units that "died" or malfunctioned after several uses have been reported, but customer service is attentive

customer_reviews.title: Just received
customer_reviews.text: I’ve already gone through a few different digital thermometers over the last 20 years. The reviews had a couple of complaints about the true temp, so I checked the calibration. The #1 was exactly 32 degrees exactly. #2 was off, it registered 35 degrees. I am fine with this because I normally use only one probe at a time. I do wish it had a calibration mode, but it doesn’t. You just place the probes in iced water for 10 minutes, then make sure the probe isn’t touching any glass for at least a minute. The temp should be at 32 degrees if correct.
customer_reviews.author: Crafty Mom

customer_reviews.title: Very sensitive to water intrusion
customer_reviews.text: This thermometer worked perfect, I liked all the options, no complaints. It misted one day while I was out cooking, not rained, barely misted... the thermometer got an extremely light layer of mist on it and shorted out. I was in disbelief. No exaggeration, the amount of water was minuscule, I still don't understand how it shorted out that easy. I'm not attempting to return or get a refund, it was my fault that the product failed, I should have been more careful.
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Lax

customer_reviews.title: Junk. It has ONE job, it can't do it.
customer_reviews.text: Tested it in ice water. Both probes gave a reading of 41 degrees. Called customer service and asked them how to calibrate it. They said there is no way to calibrate it. Then put me on hold for a few minutes. Then instructed me to put a fresh battery in it. I told them it had the "fresh" battery that came with it in the package, at which point they hung up on me. RUDE!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Ritchie

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t Hold Up
customer_reviews.text: Basically a single use product. I purchased two of these to use in my smokers. Probes were accurate on their first uses. From there they were off by 50+ degrees. I would place the probe into pork roasts that had just been removed from the cooler and they would read 120 degrees. They sent me replacement probes and I will see how they work. I got more use out of a $12 thermometer from Menards.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Sweetman

customer_reviews.title: Probes did not work.
customer_reviews.text: The probes didn’t work right. Used it for thanksgiving on a oiless fryer and the temperatures were about 50 degrees different from one probe to the other. They both were not accurate because I used my normal meat thermometer and obtained the correct reading which was about 20 degrees off from the closest probe temp.
customer_reviews.author: Don Q

customer_reviews.title: Not Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this thermometer. It is not accurate at all. It ruined my dry aged ribeye and brisket because of its in accuracy. It said my brisket internal temp was at 190 for 2 hours so when I took the temp with a different thermometer, the temperature read 215 and my brisket turned out super dry.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R.

customer_reviews.title: Crap product.  Worked for the first few times but now temp. jumps around on each probe.
customer_reviews.text: Just watched temp. jump from 98f to 120f on both probes on two dry aged tomahawk ribeyes each worth twice this POS temp probe which I bought from the positive reviews. Since I'm at the grill constantly following Kenji Lopez (Food Lab) techniques I didn't need a remote probe etc. as I am flipping constantly. I like a specific temp. steak and if you do too, this unit is a total fail. Just use your high end instant read thermometer probe and get consistently cut steaks from your butcher/grocery store and know your grills hot/cold spots. Relying on this probe will lead to inconsistent results and a hole in your screen where you threw this POS into the yard.
customer_reviews.author: JstaRnr

customer_reviews.title: Like some of the other reviews
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of issues with this probe. Like some of the other reviews, the two probes read differently. I placed the probes on either sides of a raw turkey breast and there was a ten degree temperature difference. The second problem is the material used for the probe cords. I think they are difficult to store and will kink before long which will affect their already poor performance.
customer_reviews.author: Crissy Snow

customer_reviews.title: Gave out.
customer_reviews.text: Was smoking a couple briskets over the weekend and finally put it to use. About 9hrs into the smoke I noticed it not reading the correct temp. It was stuck in the 170° area for quite some time. Took my handheld probe and realized it was false. So sadly it's going strait to the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Nye

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate reads
customer_reviews.text: The sensors are very touchy. If they're not perfectly placed in the meat, then they are not accurate. Since they're so heavy, they fall onto the grill and many times stop working completely. They're just too large and unwieldy. The also get extremely hot. I find myself having to check and recheck them. The manner feature on the back of the temp box is nice. I would not but them again.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Product worked well for a week then one probe went ...
customer_reviews.text: Product worked well for a week then one probe went out. Thermopro sent a replacement very quick. Been using it just about every weekend for 5 months and it kicked the bucket. Change batteries and it comes on and beeps a few times and shuts back off. Was hoping to get more than 5 months out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have purchased this years ago. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Compact size, 2 temperature probes (readouts for each). I use the 'beep when temperature is reached' instead of the straight time one. I primarily use this with my smoker/barbecue and the first time I used it, I was cooking pork shoulder for 60 people. Dual probes are the only way to go. Meat came out perfect and constant temp monitoring with alarm allowed me to attend to all of the other stuff I was making without worrying about the pork overcooking. I have used this many times since then with perfect results every time. Indispensable.
customer_reviews.author: A. Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate readings :( out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Initial impressions was good. Unit seems solid. Screen is large, easy to read and understand. Buuuuuut, I have both the probes within 1 inch of each other, and level with each other horizontally, and they are consistently reading 7-11 degrees different from each other in open air (in the smoker). Another probe from another unit within 1 inch shows the temp as perfectly in between these 2 probes. 11degrees out of the box is too much, that's enough to completely ruin a hundred dollars of meat and the evening. I will try to replace probes and give this item one more shot, but definitely disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great digital thermometer
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical about this product, but it works really well. I tested the accuracy against a couple other thermometers I had and it had the same readout temperature. I really like that it is magnetic and I can attach it to the front of my oven so I can watch the temperature while my food is cooking. The alert for the set temperature is really nice so I don't have to keep checking it and I can work on other parts of my meal. The large LCD screen is easy to read and it's really easy to use. I'm really happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Breanne

customer_reviews.title: Very useful!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! I used it to make marshmallows last night which requires an accurate temperature reading of 240 F. It was accurate and showed temperature changes quickly. I needed an accurate candy/ grill thermometer but wasn’t sure that this would handle candy making. It does! The clip it comes with wasn’t for a pan. It’s for clipping to grill/oven grates. I had an extra pot clip that fit, so that worked. The magnetic back was a nice surprise since I hadn’t noticed that in the description. I am making toffee tonight and a prime rib for Christmas. I’m looking forward to using this!
customer_reviews.author: Alice Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Not Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what to say. I cooked a very expensive 10 pound standing rib roast, so I used both probes, both into the center, but from different sides. When one got to the final temperature, 120F, the other read 103F. Luckily, I was also cooking by time, so I left the roast in until the timer went off. The roast was perfectly cooked, an even medium rare throughout. Had I cooked by the thermometers, using one would have resulted in an undercooked roast, while the using the other would have resulted in an overcooked roast. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisFromMaryland

customer_reviews.title: So much better than my instant-read!
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time on Thanksgiving. WOW. My absolute favorite feature is that the probes can stay in the food the entire time while the display magnetizes to the front of my stove. For our 20lb turkey, I had the probes in the thigh and breast. Once the breast got to 162, the thigh was around 159. I went ahead and took the turkey out to rest. It. Was. Perfect. I like how it beeps when it reaches the set temperature, making it easy to know when it was done. Looking forward to using this on our green egg to smoke some brisket!
customer_reviews.author: M. D. Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Has worked perfect so far. Very accurate. We were using a fork style thermometer and our food was getting over cooked. This has been accurate on our chicken, burgers, turkey filets, pork. Easy to clean. Love the magnet on the display unit. We stick it to our fridge when not in use. I do wish it had a little holder or something for the probes. I might start putting them in a toothbrush holder maybe. Just to keep them a little tame in the drawer. The probe cords are nice and long and so they get a little wild in the drawer. But we love this thermometer. The dual option is awesome by the way.
customer_reviews.author: Waneta

customer_reviews.title: Great utility thermometer, too.
customer_reviews.text: Inserted into roast beef, temperature stabilizes at 140F in about 3 seconds. Have used this about ten times now without problems, also for monitoring liquid temperature when heating to 160F for pasteurizing. Alarm is loud and persistent, returning after shutoff if the temperature again rises through the setpoint. Dual probe is nice for confirming oven temp and food temp while door is closed. Simple, straightforward operation as either a single alarm thermometer, dual alarm thermometer, or timer. Like that it uses AAA batteries, not coin batteries. Replacement probes (Type E, Nickel-Chromium/Constantan) readily available, even at Wally's for ~$8.
customer_reviews.author: Essais

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate temperature reading!
customer_reviews.text: The ThermoPro has great features and the controls are easy to understand. Be forewarned though, my unit shows inaccurate temperature readings. We used it to cook our Thanksgiving turkey. Instructions on turkey package said to cook until breast was 170° and wing to 180°F. Unit reached 172°F and we disconnected the unit. Sliced into turkey between breast and drumstick and blood ran out. Contacted company and they said to test in ice water. Did so and instead of correct reading of 32°F, mine read 41°F. Contacted company again and reported this. they sent a new probe that arrived today. Only thing is, the probe arrived bent at a 45° angle. Contacted again, requesting another new probe. Will update later.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Totally unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I waited to use this probe until Thanksgiving. When it read 157F I too the turkey out and used an instant read thermometer. Ir read 135 in the same hole. This happened a week earlier with some chicken but I thought I had perhaps hit a bone. Nope. The ThermoPro TP-17 just doesn't work properly. If you purchase this product check it our as soon as you get it so you can sent it back. I waited and am now out both the money and an accurate thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Works great at first but doesn't last long...
customer_reviews.text: I've only had it 4 months. Worked great at first, then one of the probes went haywire and was giving a reading of 250+ degrees when it wasn't being used. The other probe is fine and reads correctly. I've only used it a handful of times because I use it specifically in my smoker. I have sent Thermo Pro emails with no response. Can't say I'd recommend it to anyone or buy another one of their products.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: simple and reliable, excellent price
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes simple is better than complicated. I have owned 3 expensive wireless bluetooth thermometers and another wireless thermometer. None of them work as advertised. This thermometer is not wireless (a good thing IMO) but it's reliable and very functional. The dual thermometer/timer mode is especially helpful for my reverse sear technique, which requires frequent, regular turning.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted for one use.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to monitor the temperature of a ham. It gave extremely high temperature reading. !36 degrees when actual temperature was 97. It started beeping and flashing and then stopped. Would not reset. Would not turn off. Never restarted. Changed battery. Did not work. Would not even turn off when power was off. Not very happy with a product that got rave reviews very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I had Maverick two piece thermometer for about fifteen years and it finally gave up the ghost. I tried very inexpensive Taylor set, but it just turned to be very cheap (cont-intuitive control and broke fast). Finally I bought this ThermoPro TP-17 and so far am very glad I did. It has very simple and intuitive controls, seems to be fast and the probe's wire is well protected (unlike Taylor's). I still need to test accuracy (freezing point and boiling point) and only time will tell how durable it is, but so far I am happy with thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Grisha

customer_reviews.title: Great Thermometer for everything from smoker to broiler.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to give this unit a try and I am glad that I did. I have tested it against a number of calibrated certified units I have and this Thermometer is +/- 2° in the over and spot-on in the smoker and my barrel cooker. The only gripes are that I wish the leads were longer when I am hot and fast cooking. I would like to get it just a bit further away from the cooker. In-direct sunlight, the BIG numbers are easy to read but the glare from the screen causes me to have to move the control around. waaaaa waaaaa I know right, Never mind about the gripes, It's a great unit.
customer_reviews.author: DKH

customer_reviews.title: Not useful for intended purpose.  Total fail.
customer_reviews.text: Meat probe reads high. When immersed into ice water both probes are within 2 degress of each other and 1 degree from an independent digital thermometer. In the smoker however, the probe inserted into the meat seems to pick up stray heat from the enrivonment. Currently reading meat temp of 120 degrees vs 97 degrees using an independent instant probe. The other probe measuring the smoker temperature appears correct. Clearly useless for intended purpose of monitoring temperature of meat. On the plus side, it is easy to see what the temperature isn't.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Cutler

customer_reviews.title: Less then 2 months old.....
customer_reviews.text: First, I never really checked to insure accuracy but it's on or damn close. I also like the compact design. Easy to set and use. BUT! After 8 or 10 uses it has a number on the display already gone bad. When I set the #1 probe, I only get the first 2 numbers. Doesn't bode well for it's future longevity! There are many, many other competitive priced brands to choose from, so you may want to avoid this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: We have a JenAir stove with grill. Just set your temp at 1/2 way flip your meat. Beeps when done. Perfect every time. Has 2 probes 2 settings ( his and hers). Sturdy easy to read backlit. Stainless case. Worth the money wish I’d bought it long ago. No more guessing no more cutting meat to look. I’m MR hubby is Med. for me med is the hardest to cook it’s only med for a very short time then we’ll done. Now he gets meat his way. Very nice quality unit would make great gift. PS will work in air fryer as well!
customer_reviews.author: Year of the Ox

customer_reviews.title: Worked for less than a year.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for less than a year. I’ve consistently been undercooking chicken. I finally used our regular thermometer at the same time - 140 vs 200 on this ThermoPro. No wonder! I would not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems to Offer Good Value For Money
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through three or four similar devices. I have only used this one twice and it did work as expected. The dual probes are a nice feature that I didn't have on any of the other ones. In each prior case, the device worked for a time, sometimes a month or two, sometimes a couple of years, so I cannot report on this device's longevity, but it does seem to be made well, and the communication and customer support from the company definitely instill confidence. I don't have enough experience with this for an outright recommendation, but it seems to be well made and appears to be a good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bud Izen

customer_reviews.title: Key Element for Smokers
customer_reviews.text: Performs well and appears to be of decent build. Received and used with 1st timer smoker experience. Ability to monitor temperature on a constant basis is very helpful vs the periodic temp stick. Only issue is based on my novice smoker experience - afraid I would damage probe cables with the sealed smoker door. Could not find any Internet guidance on this issue. Finally fed the probe cables thru the smoker vent and it worked out.
customer_reviews.author: chw

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.....buy me, buy me!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so easy to use and keeps me from 'peeking' in the grill/smoker. You can use 1 or 2 of the probes at a time, the length of the wires is great, love the strong magnetic feature, all the presets for different kinds of meat make it easy, and the alarm is loud enough to hear it across the yard or a couple rooms away in the house. IF there is a negative, I would say the probes are so long that you have to position your meat strategically at times in order to get the probe where you want it. I would buy this again without hesitation and recommend this probe highly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be more clear.
customer_reviews.text: I really like ThermPro products and operationally, this one did not disappoint. I will say that although I have used it only once. I found the directions in the accompanying booklet very vague and lacking overall. I will look at the video to see if that clears things up but my main criticism is that I feel I should be able to us the item to its capacity with out having to read instructions and then watch a video, I have a responsibility as a consumer to read materials that accompany a purchased item. The manufacturer has a responsibility to me - their customer - to insure I can use it with relative ease.
customer_reviews.author: salmon31544

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly useful even if you roast only one thing at a time
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a Taylor. I'd had it for 5 years and it finally punked out on me. Turned out, when we looked to rebuy it, that mine was an anomaly - most punked out a lot earlier. The thing had horrible reviews. So, I looked for one that was similar and that had good reviews and found this one. Love it. It is super accurate, it's easy to care for (just don't get the top sensor thingy wet) and it makes a nice ruckus when the correct temp has been reached; I can hear it anywhere in my small house. Roasting meat with a thermometer is truly the trick to perfect results every time.
customer_reviews.author: L. Grundy

customer_reviews.title: Good to measure temperature but hard to change
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my father. It has a long probe which is difficult to use in an air fryer but it appears to be accurate. It is extremely difficult to change the type of meat from beef to pork to chicken. The directions say press the button but it doesn't work. I stumbled upon a solution which is to press two buttons at the same time - something that is not in the manual. But given the thermometer works I can adjust to watching it instead of relying on it to beep for the wrong meat type.
customer_reviews.author: bkhs81

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use and very accurate.
customer_reviews.text: I used this so far for a Thanksgiving turkey and few whole chickens and a prime rib roast. It is so nice to have 2 probes to ensure an accurate reading. one probe is not enough in my opinion. I have had perfect result with each dinner and could not be happier. The probes are easy to wash and plenty long enough to extend out past the oven does and yes the oven will close no problem with these leads. I would not hesitate to buy the product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fiore

customer_reviews.title: Worked well...until the rain came
customer_reviews.text: I liked this thermometer. It was easy to use, accurate and was easy to read. It lasted a while until I was BBQing some pork shoulder and it rained. It completely stopped working. I put it in a container with rice and one side came back to life but not the other. If you purchase for long cooks, you may want to get one of those phone case/bags that protect your phone around water.
customer_reviews.author: erictepe

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I have requested a return for a replacement, the one I received passed the “boiling water” test, both probes read between 210 and 211 which is spot on for my elevation, however within 30 min of its maiden cook, the screen started blinking out. Infrared of the spot it’s sitting says 110, so not over heated. If I unplug the probes, the screen goes back to normal. So tired of products failing out of the box, I’m sure the replacement will be fine but it shouldn’t need replacing. Pay a few extra bucks and get a better unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They then mailed ma e new probe at no cost and everything works good now. This unit does have a very loud ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a problem with a temperature difference between the two probes. I emailed customer service and they had me try a couple of troubleshooting tips and still had the issue. They then mailed ma e new probe at no cost and everything works good now. This unit does have a very loud alarm compared to other I've had in the past. Great product & customer service. REVISED 9/11/18 - went to use it over the weekend and won't power on. I tried several batteries and nothing. Not sure if I will purchase another one or not. I didn't even get one whole grilling season out of it.
customer_reviews.author: jason s

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate Readings After A Couple Uses
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine the first time but disappointed with the durability. the unit is fine but I’m on my 3rd cook and temps are WAY off. They were off by 7-10 degrees on my second cook and probably 30-40 degrees on my 3rd cook. I’ve only had long cooks on the smoker for briskets so not sure if it can’t handle the prolonged use or something else. The unit seems fine, maybe it’s the probes but I can’t tell. It’s inexpensive so not overly upset but definitely disappointed it’s already not useful. Especially after all the good reviews here.
customer_reviews.author: park

customer_reviews.title: Not built to last
customer_reviews.text: This really seemed to be a great product at first. I used it maybe a half a dozen times in the first year of ownership. About one year in, one of the probes started giving a hi reading. I tested it by temping a pot of boiling water and it was six or eight degrees too high. I thought maybe the issue was the probe so I bought a replacement. The replacement worked for about 5 minutes and now they are all reading 12 to 15 degrees High. Extremely frustrating when you are in the middle of a job and suddenly tools stop working.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Wernet

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Turkey
customer_reviews.text: We just did a pre-Thanksgiving Turkey to test it out and it worked VERY WELL! We had a perfectly cooked, moist turkey, using an electric roaster we bought 15 years ago, and which usually overcooks the turkey. We used both probes one on each side of the turkey embedded in the breast. We are ready for Thanksgiving.
customer_reviews.author: Rodge55

customer_reviews.title: Meh, worked for 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I really love using this thermometer. Makes grilling super easy and cheese making a breeze. However, now coming up on year 2 and one probe quit reading properly and the second one now no longer works. Then today the reader started going crazy blinking, HHH reading and switching from C to F on it's own. I use this thermometer several times a week, so if you're going to use it hard, realize that'll it'll quit at some point sooner than you probably expect it. Probably going to put a little more money into a better quality brand this next time.
customer_reviews.author: xltin4god

customer_reviews.title: Screw loose
customer_reviews.text: Opened the package and noticed there is a screw loose rubbling around inside. I am concerned the screw will cause a short. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Mark R

customer_reviews.title: good thermometer and good customer service
customer_reviews.text: I use this thermometer a lot, for things like homemade yogurt, where the temperatures really matter, as well as general food safety when cooking meats and poultry, and have been very happy with it, and I even bought one for my daughter. I am writing a review now because the company just sent me a replacement probe for one that stopped working. I am so pleased with the customer service in addition to the excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: EYC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, must have for oven cooking
customer_reviews.text: Bought this originally for Thanksgiving, but continue to find uses for them all year long. This product is awesome. So incredibly easy to use. Having two prongs is very helpful. We can do one in the meat and one taking an oven temp using the included rack clip, or check two spots of the meat (breast and thigh), or maybe you're reverse searing two steaks, can use one probe in each. Cleaning is very easy, the prongs detach and are easily wiped clean. The base station also makes it easy to set a desired temp and get an audible alert when the prongs hit temperature. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: The probes are sensitive to placement
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my dual thermometer for use in cooking my de-boned 20+ lb Thanksgiving and Christmas turkeys and a bone in ham. I was getting two inconsistent readings at first and was perplexed. I thought there was an issue with one probe. One registered too hot too quickly. After contacting the company they suggested there was an issue with my placement of the probe into the meats. That was correct. With careful placement the dual probes work well, especially when I cook separate light and dark meat turkey boneless roasts in 1:20 hrs. Any opinion on durability will have to wait for further use.
customer_reviews.author: DCG

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for a Dual Probe Cooking Thermometer
customer_reviews.text: I used it the day it arrived to cook a Ham. The sensor worked great - the time indicated on the Ham package (2 1/2 hours for a 10 lbs Ham) was almost exactly when the Digital thermometer hit 140 degrees (which is what the USDA recommends for a USDA inspected pre-cooked Ham). It was very easy to set up and use. I have not used all the bells and whistles of the other programing options, but I am looking forward to cooking with this device in the future. I am very pleased with this purchase as it worked well and was at a very good price point.
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: Great...When it wants to work.
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate the 2 probes, the preset temp settings, and the alarm when the meat gets to temp! However, mine for some reason tends to freak out and freeze when I first turn it on or when I am adjusting the temp in the middle of a cook. It is easily fixed after 5 minutes of turning on, off, taking out the battery and putting it back in, slapping it a little. This is a nuisance more than anything but for $20 I can't complain. It is very accurate and I use it as an instant-read for things like burgers or chops.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Not the worst, not the best, but definitely not long-lasting!
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to work decently for the first several times it was in use. Then maybe about the 5th time the digital display would flicker. I changed the battery, that seemed to fix it. Two times after that, the celsius fahrenheit switch started shorting out, I had to move it several times to get it to stay on fahrenheit. The next time it was used was it's last, the screen showed partial numbers when turned on. Once again, I replaced the battery, and finally it would not come back on. I did like both probes, the night light, and the accuracy seemed good as well. But, I expected it to last longer than maybe 7-8 uses.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Completely inaccurate readings! Avoid or you’ll ruin your best steaks.
customer_reviews.text: Awful product. I have owned this product for a few months now and I wish I had never purchased it. The readings were clearly inaccurate and I couldn’t quite figure out why I was getting so many steaks wrong. Last week it started doing something new: the 2 probes gave me a different reading and this is when I figured out the product was crap. I put the probes to test my sous-vide water temperature and you can see it for yourself in the picture. The sous-vide tell me 99F, and the Thermopro gives 2 different readings that are off 30-40 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: G. CRISTERNA

customer_reviews.title: Good thermometer
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to the grilling. Stick the two probes in the meats and/or vegetables and sit back. When your preset food reaches temperature it beeps. Downside is a lot of the food temperatures are predetermined and if want a little less or more cooking time you need to manually overtime. Need to be careful removing the probes because they stay hot for awhile, which you find out fairly quickly if not careful.
customer_reviews.author: Duckman

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Works great. Accurate. I just built this smoker and needed a thermometer for the meat. I have a similar unit that we use to cook meat in the oven and I like the simplicity of it so I looked for something like that and found this product. The magnetic back is perfect for my setup. The unit also comes with pre-set temperatures that use icons for various meats and fish and poultry so you can just choose one of them instead of inputting an exact number. I plan to buy another and use on for each side of my smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Mokujin

customer_reviews.title: It works perfectly and is a quality unit
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before buying this. My main reason for buying it is that it allows a temperature alarm when the temperature drops below a temperature you set. My main use if for making yoghurt, where the milk needs to be heated (so I set the unit to sound an alarm when 100 degrees is reached) and then needs to cool (so I then set the alarm to sound when the temperature then drops to 43 degrees). I now also use it for cooking food in the oven - it is excellent. The instructions are clear and the support from the manufacturer was great. Peter
customer_reviews.author: MR PETER ROZSY

customer_reviews.title: When precise temperatures are required.
customer_reviews.text: Until recently I've always cooked meat judging its doneness by its look. And in my efforts to make certain the meat was cooked adequately, I've often overcooked both pork and chicken to the point of dryness. Since I've begun using this thermometer, I am confident that my food is both safe and delicious. I have used this thermometer in my iron skillet, oven, crock pot, and microwave, and the meat has been perfect every time. This is a wonderful and necessary cooking tool, and I'm so glad to have it.
customer_reviews.author: CHP WebShopper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect thermometer for big slabs of meat 7 pounds and bigger.
customer_reviews.text: This thermometer is great for big pieces of meat. You insert one tab on each side of the meat to make sure its cook the same all the way around. Sometimes one side of the meat will be cook more than the other. Make sure to spin the meat dish around every so many hours especially for pork shoulder or best brisket. That way it comes the same. If you have a convection oven with a fan then you shouldnt have to spin any meats around. My oven is an older version but still gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolute junk!
customer_reviews.text: Stay clear of this. The purpose of a meat thermometer is to tell you what the tempeture of your meat is... Well this one fails at that. Right away on the first use i was off by 10-20 degrees ... Thank god I used my igrill mini as a verification.. I needed more than one probe so I bought this because it has two.. Well besides during my cooking it being off, now probe one says it's 185 degrees in my house and won't move while probe two says it's 43....... I'll be returning this ASAP and just gonna drop the money on a multiple igrill.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Symiczek

customer_reviews.title: From the Kitchen to the Grill
customer_reviews.text: First off, this dual probe thermometer actually works, unlike the ones you get in the cooking stores. After a week of using this, I threw out a drawer full of probes and digital thermometers I had accumulated over the years. However, I do have 2 issues. The adhesive on the magnets is too weak to hold the thermometer and eventually I have to pick it up off the floor. 3M VHB Heavy Duty Mounting Tape is the solution to that problem. That tape is truly industrial. The second issue is the beeper. The sound is too low. A little volume control would be nice. It's still worth 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: nanomatrix

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate, but difficult to set up at first.
customer_reviews.text: Was great for it's first trial run and my prime roast for the holidays. Setting it, alerts, alarms etc. A bit confusing, after a few uses maybe get the hang of it. Need to watch the video I guess because the instructions were really hard to follow. Got it, but took time. Skipped all that when it really came time though, I just stuck the one probe in the roast, the other clipped to the rack, and all was good. I do like the dual probes for that, monitoring the oven and meat at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Funkywtboy

customer_reviews.title: On the fence
customer_reviews.text: I am on the fence with this thermometer. It's accurate, but tricky to use, and not sure if there is an easier way. The wires to probes can get tangled, and when working on a very hot grill, that gets frustrating. Especially when turning over. I will continue to try and use them on large items. Not really useful on fish, or boneless breasts, and in fairness not really needed.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Smithy

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: So I bought the probe and used it with my Oil Free Turkey Fryer, and the Turkey that I cooked came out perfect. I will warn you to be careful and not place the device directly on the Fryer or Grill as it is plastic. I made that mistake and the back of mine started to melt, however the device continued to work and I am still using it. I will replace it eventually, because the cost and functionality make it well worth the value.
customer_reviews.author: WiseWill65

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should own one
customer_reviews.text: For something like a large Thanksgiving turkey having two probes is a help. They are also good for two different items in the oven. Update: If the controller/read out is attached to the face of the range in a location where hot air from the range can blow over it, the plastic battery cover and the stand can soften (and possibly melt over time. ) I put mine too close to the oven vent. My fault but it still loses a star. The instructions could have warned me.
customer_reviews.author: Sybil's friend

customer_reviews.title: Not a long lasting probe
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in January of this year. I stored it with my smoker out of elements in my heated garage carefully. Loved this probe very accurate. Sadly the screen has completely gone wonky and no longer displays anything but a dull blue light. This started about 2 months ago and slowly got worse. Didn't expect to be buried with this item but a little more than six months would have been nice. Save your time and spend a little more on a better product is my opinion and advice.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Mall

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased With
customer_reviews.text: I think I've had this a couple years now. It doesn't get used every day but it certainly works good when I use it. It's nice in that it will keep track of temps on two different pieces of meat, and I believe it only takes 1 AAA battery. (Pretty economical). It has a magnetic back so it sits solid on the front tray of my smoker. I like the display. You have lots of options. I like that it will signal you when it has reached temp. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: John in Warrensburg, MO

customer_reviews.title: Really not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this about 8-10 times. In the oven and with my smoker. At about the 3-4th time I started getting erroneous reading on one of the probes. One read 45° the other 60°, both pieces of meat had been in the fridge for 24hrs plus.
customer_reviews.author: agorastís

customer_reviews.title: Ranks with expensive thermometers
customer_reviews.text: Let me fist start out by saying that when I first started using thermometers in the kitchen, they never lasted, either by user error or some sort of unit failure. I have now gone through about 15 different models in the $15-$35 range, all different brands. I must say the TP 17 has by far surpassed all of them in every category I deem important and I’ve put them through a lot. I was impressed with the ThermPro brand so I decided to upgrade to the TP 20. After about 15 cooks, I found the TP 17 to be more accurate then the TP 20. Definitely a good buy and you can’t beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My second thermopro digital product. And I really am NOT impressed with the accuracy.
customer_reviews.text: My second thermopro product in six months and the accuracy of the probes leaves A LOT to be desired. There is once again at least a 9-11 degree difference between probes, depending on the day. And a 8 degree difference from my high end Fluke digital thermometer. Going to buy a different brand next time around.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Kupiec

customer_reviews.title: Very Good except for alarm
customer_reviews.text: Have used twice and it is fast acting but both probes seem to read about 7 to 10 degrees higher than 2 other devices I compared it to. Steak read 132 but it was rare. Pellet smoker use is great to have cook temp and food temp on same gauge and magnet mount is perfect. I will keep it and just subtract 8 degrees from the readings or have an additional device when temp gets close. The temp alarms are very annoying as you have to reset them to silence and there is no way to turn them off permanently.
customer_reviews.author: Lifelong Tech

customer_reviews.title: Love It!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thermometer. It took me forever to realize all of the features. It has taken my cooking to another level. I use it when cooking BBQ and in the oven. The alarm that you notifies you when your food has reached the predetermined temperature is loud enough that I can hear in the house when I have food on the grill. It is not super loud or annoying but loud enough to hear from a distance.
customer_reviews.author: Ramone Pearson

customer_reviews.title: So far I am very pleased with this meat thermometer
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very pleased with this meat thermometer. I have used it on the grill a few times as well as in the oven. Results displayed have been accurate. It has a collapsable stand built into the back as well as two magnets that hold the weight of the thermometer securely. The quality of the product seems pretty rugged. The Screen is bright and easy to read in daylight and the alarm beep in plenty loud enough. So far I am pleased with the purchase and am happy paying the price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Arbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Great System.. better customer support!
customer_reviews.text: Great system and great customer service. I found that I had a bad probe out of the box. Temps were about 30 degrees different in the same glass of ice water I used to make sure they were working correctly. I thought I was hosed because I had purchased the system over a month before but only used one probe until I had to test them due to over cooking some meat. I emailed the itronic customer support last Saturday and had a new probe in hand this Friday. Was also informed of a 3 year warranty on the device and lifetime on the probes!! Sweet! couldn’t be happier. Would recommend to anyone looking for a digital thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: tonbetter

customer_reviews.title: Great Concept, But Gave Incorrect Readings
customer_reviews.text: Overall the concept of the product is great, but unfortunately it did not work for me. Pros: The settings are very simple and straight forward. The screen is easy to read and navigate. Cons: Showed an incorrect internal temperature while cooking a prime rib. Used probes in different parts of the meat and both were off by at least 30 degrees which was disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: amoeba

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, dependable
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for smoking briskets and the like. This has performed very well and accurately. I’ve smoked 5 briskets (average of 10 hours each) and 2 pork bellies so far and I haven’t had to change the battery yet. The temperature is easy to set and check. There’s an alarm that goes off when you go over a preset temperature. That’s very handy and useful especially when you’re away from the smoker.
customer_reviews.author: James S

customer_reviews.title: Faulty item, bad customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Had this thermometer 2 months. Pork roast came out very pink. This thermometer showed temp as fully cooked, while my old thermometer showed 15 degrees cooler. Listing for this item says they'll replace probes but good luck finding the link to contact them. I could not.
customer_reviews.author: ms

customer_reviews.title: TP-17 Dual Probe Digital Cooking Meat Thermometer
customer_reviews.text: This thermometer is wonderful, double temperature sensor can be cooked dor meat types with different temperature readings or you can use a sensor to see the temperature of the grill, it also has a timer that is very useful also has control buttons physicists with a very intuitive interface, I am quite satisfied with my purchase and I highly recommend it, besides the customer service is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Esteban Pena

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Intuitive  to use
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy set up a snap to use and handy to make your smoked meats come out perfectly. I did a whole pork loin of Canadian Bacon and this device was just the ticket for controlling smoker temp and knowing when the loin internal reached 160 deg F. Guarantee on the probes works too, as they are sending a replacement probe for one that was accidentally overheated!
customer_reviews.author: Scuba Dog

customer_reviews.title: Need a place to secure probes!
customer_reviews.text: Its bad enough when manufacturers dont provide a simple hole to hold the probe, but this 2... it really stinks. The unit is only a few degrees off over a 200F calibration range, so not bad at all. The on/off/function slider and tiny stand leave something to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: Ringo5000

customer_reviews.title: NOT accurate
customer_reviews.text: Used this for 1st time on Thanksgiving for a 23 lb. turkey. After 25 minutes the probe in the breast beeped, the temp reached 165 degrees, 10 minutes later the 2nd probe (in thigh) reached 165 degrees. I moved one probe in a little and the other out a little, same readings. I used my old thermometer that is known to work and the readings were much lower. Sending this one back.
customer_reviews.author: TeeDee

customer_reviews.title: Great for cooking  because of the 2 probes I can cook two dishes at once in my dual ovens
customer_reviews.text: Great for cooking because of the 2 probes I can cook two dishes at once in my dual ovens makes it Easy Breasy. Before I was having to move probe between dishes. I wish the alarms was louder. But very handy instruction are hard to follow if you are a linear thinker like my self. Easy to follow like reading A review on spirulina (Arthrospira Platensis) for its antioxidant and neuroprotective effect
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Probe Broke
customer_reviews.text: Used both probes in my oven. 1 for meat and 1 for ambient temp. Worked great. Then tried it in my small camping grill with both burners on low and one probe worked fine for around 20 minutes and then started flashing HHHH as if the temp was higher than 700F as shown in the instructions. Took the probe out and tested it after it cooled off and the probe continued to flash HHHH. Probe was not in direct contact with flame and the grill on low was no more than 400F.
customer_reviews.author: Desire B.

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: It's simple and it works well. I use it mostly for checking oil temperature while deep fat frying. It seems to be decently accurate and is simple to use. Runs on a single AAA battery. The temperature probe and cable seems to be fairly robust and temperature resistant, although, I do keep the main unit itself a bit further away from any heat (doesn't look very temperature resistant, and I don't really want to find out if it isn't). Overall, it's pretty nice.
customer_reviews.author: IK

customer_reviews.title: Surprising Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: The food thermometer I purchased 10 months earlier failed, it was a faulty connection in the probe. With the holidays approaching I purchased a new upgraded device from Amazon. I explained the situation of the failed device to their customer service folks via email, expecting a Sorry but there is nothing we can do. I had no receipt for my original purchase. They still offered to replace the faulty probe at no cost. Some times companies surprise you.
customer_reviews.author: R Pearse

customer_reviews.title: ThermoPro Has Made Me A Barbecue Pro
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those products any cooking enthusiast should have. Sure, I've always used a manual temperature probe, but this is so nice because you can set the desired temps on both probes and leave them in the grill with the lid closed. An alarm sounds as each probe reaches its threshold. I think it's a good buy and hope to use it for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Dave P

customer_reviews.title: Died For No Reason!
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 6 months and then died for no apparent reason. Went to turn it on and the display only showed gibberish. It wasn’t exposed to heat, dropped, or damaged prior to malfunctioning, and we tried replacing the batteries. No dice. If you get this expect to be replacing it a few times a year.
customer_reviews.author: Greg and Trish

customer_reviews.title: Makes smoking meat an easy feat
customer_reviews.text: Great for multiple things in the smoker. I have a large smoker and put 2 briskets and 2 racks of ribs on. Each brisket cooked differently and this thermometer allowed me to not have one that was perfect and one that was shoe leather. The only reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is that the cables could have been a little longer for the size of my smoker. For any Bradley, traeger or most other smokers they will be sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: I don 't know why I waited so long to try one of these oven thermometers. I had just about given up on ever cooking chicken breast or pork loins again. They always came out too dry. I found it impossible to do it well ... Until I got this. Goodness, what a difference it made. I am once again enjoying foods I had long given up on. Definitely worth getting if you want your food cooked to the proper temperature and have it come out tender.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: USE ON A TURKEY BREAST AND THIGH
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift to my son and we used it on our Thanksgiving turkey. One probe in the breast and one in the thigh. When the breast meat reached 165-170, we removed the breast from the turkey and put the turkey back in the oven until the thigh reached 180. I've been baking turkeys for decades and this breast meat was the JUICIEST! It was dripping! Tender and juicy all through the chew. OMGoodness, it was GOOD! Only because of this thermometer!
customer_reviews.author: Judy D.

customer_reviews.title: Base unit malfunctioned.
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box, the second temperature display was off by as much as 20F. I swapped probes and same display was still off. So it's the base unit that's bad, not the probe.
customer_reviews.author: g

customer_reviews.title: Works well but probes are a little long and easy to burn fingers
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and read. Bought to use in my foodie grill to start. They are a little long so getting both inside and shutting the lid can be challenging. Even though it tells you to use gloves to handle the probes it’s instinct to grab them. Both of us burned our fingers the first time we used it. Also the knurled ends of the probes can be challenging to clean. Love that I can use two at a time and the pre-sets for meat temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: Christa

customer_reviews.title: PERFECTION!
customer_reviews.text: I received this the day after I placed my order. I opened the box, washed the probes and inserted the included battery and was immediately in business. I like my steaks rare and I didn't even have to set anything except the rare setting. When my steaks reached the appropriate temperature, the ThermoPro set off an alarm letting me know my food was cooked. Can't green egg without this. Wish there were room for two more thermometers, but I'll just order another one. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Joe La

customer_reviews.title: Definitely wrong on turkeys!
customer_reviews.text: Used this at Thanksgiving and it was a nightmare. It said turkey was done HOURS before it was. Thank goodness I trusted my gut and tossed this thing in the drawer and went with what I "knew" and not what it told me. Can't say I'd recommend this item for such big things. Maybe a small cut of meat on a grill??
customer_reviews.author: Beth J.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until I goofed
customer_reviews.text: It worked as expected and was great until I ruined it. The control box has a magnet so you can stick it in a convient spot. Without thinking one day I didn't insure I mounted it on a part of the grill that does not get hot and it ended up melting. Totaly my fault for not making sure it it was heat proof or for making sure I stuck it some place that would stay cool. live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: Bluedog

customer_reviews.title: Great product and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Really a great product, just cooked a chicken on the grill. Used one probe in the chicken breast and the other to monitor the grill temperature inside. Set the desired temperature on both probes and closed the lid. The alarm sounded when the chicken was ready. Didn't have to peek anytime during the cooking. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Chalkley

customer_reviews.title: A must have for fool-proof cooking!!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this product and this company. Very easy to use, and absolutely simplifies cooking as I know it now. Don't know what I did before using this product. Yes I do. I continually overcooked or undercooked everything I attempted to make. This thermometer takes all the guessing away from baking, roasting, broiling, and grilling every type of meat. I love, love, love it. Ald this company stands 100% behind their product. Absolutely no hassle replacement should you have any issues. Amazing!! Five stars! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Barnhill

customer_reviews.title: Pretty ok I think
customer_reviews.text: Just recently received and checked the probes in both ice and boiling water, ice was 32 p1 and 34 p2, I can deal with that. Boiling water was 212 and 212. That is more than good, however, don't lose the manual. Seems a little confusing to me as the instructions (they are in English) are a bit complicated. May be just me. As of now...would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren B. Blowers

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this meat thermometer for over a year now and I just purchased one for my dad. The thermometer is easy to read and still reads accurately. It’s easy to set the temperature you’re looking for and the chime in the thermometer is loud enough to hear from inside your house. Unless you want a Bluetooth thermometer, this one should be on your short list of essential items for smoking.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Meat Thermometer!
customer_reviews.text: We cooked chicken with it the other night. The probe told us to take the chicken out of the oven 5 minutes earlier than the recipe stated. We did so, to see if it was accurate. The chicken was cooked through perfectly, moist, and delicious! Had we followed the recipe time, it likely would've been dry. Excited to keep using this meat thermometer!
customer_reviews.author: Robin James

customer_reviews.title: I love my thermopro TP-17
customer_reviews.text: I love my Thermopro it has duel temperature settings I’ve used it for baking in the oven, and smoking meat on the grill it’s a great product. The only problem I’ve had is that the battery compartment cover accidentally fell into the grill I need a new cover but the TP-17 still works. And it’s up to me to order a new cover. Great product you can’t go wrong with. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: IamHammer

customer_reviews.title: The best I've used so far
customer_reviews.text: I like to grill. A lot. I'm also a diehard Weber fan and decided to buy their high priced, app-enabled thermometer set. It cost several times more than the ThermoPro. I was sorely disappointed when it stopped working after a few months. Truly worthless. So, I went ahead and purchased the ThermoPro and I was thoroughly impressed! It is well built, accurate, and easy to use. Wonderful product! Don't waste your money on anything else. Get this product and perfect your grilling technique this summer!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Antunez

product_meta.title: ThermoPro TP-17 Dual Probe Digital Cooking Meat Thermometer Large LCD Backlight Food Grill Thermometer with Timer Mode for Smoker Kitchen Oven BBQ, Silver
feature_bullets: Set your desired food temp & HI/LOW temp range for your grill or smoker to know when to add more fuel! Smoker thermometer will flash and beep to remind you if the temperature ever goes out your set range; HI/LOW temp range alarm is specifically designed for usage with smokers, grills and BBQ

DUAL probe grill thermometer makes it easy to monitor temperatures of two pieces of meat or grill temperature without swapping probes or using different devices! Includes USDA preset temperatures and can also adjust set temperature manually.

Backlit and large LCD BBQ thermometer displays both food /oven/grill/smoker temps and timer for the most intuitive experience when cooking at night outdoors. Flip-out counter top stand and magnetic back allow the meat thermometer to be placed anywhere within the kitchen or grill environments.

Oven thermometer with step-down probe design retrieves temperature precisely and quickly, alerting you of temp changes in seconds; 40" stainless steel mesh cables rated for 716°F connects thermometer to base, which is located outside of oven/grill/smoker.
ThermoPro food thermometer with a temperature range of 14˚F to 572˚F (-10˚C to 300˚C) and high accuracy of ±1.8°F (±1°C), can display both Fahrenheit and Celsius readings.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars6,223 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
